meanings.definition: The act or process of enervating.
meanings.sent1: Her enervations after the long hike were evident in her tired expression.
meanings.sent2: The enervations caused by the stressful situation left him feeling drained.
meanings.sent3: Despite his enervations, he managed to complete the task with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The enervations of defeat weighed heavily on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The enervations of constant worry gnawed at her peace of mind.

meanings.sent1: The enervations of the flu kept her in bed for days.
meanings.sent2: His enervations were visible in his sluggish movements.
meanings.sent3: Even with his enervations, he tried to keep up with the group.
meanings.sent4: The enervations of disappointment lingered long after the event.
meanings.sent5: The enervations of a long day at work made him yearn for rest.
